data.title: Quaint place in the heart of downtown.
data.text: Went to Colby's recently.   Having heard great things from a number of friends I wasn't disappointed.   Great local restaurant in the heart of downtown next to major attractions in Owensboro!!!!  I got the our house chicken plate!  It was fabulous grilled chicken breast with bbq sauce and ham and cheese melted on top.   It came with a side and a house salad!  Dressing was homemade in house and you could tell!   I got the onion straws as my side and they were fabulous!!  I would definitely go back!   Great little find

data.title: Excellent
data.text: We've eaten many times at Colby's.  The atmosphere is great and the food is always hot.  Very friendly staff.

data.title: Love the atmosphere and food!
data.text: My husband and I live about 30 minutes from Colby's and have many offerings in the Evansville area.  However, we were looking for something different and dined with another couple on a Friday night. We were quite pleased with the atmosphere, food and the service.  (I left a jacket that night, so we returned the following week and absolutely loved it again.)  Our server was attentive, but seemed to forget us after bill was paid.  Admittedly, we sat at the table for a while but would have appreciated a water refill.  I loved the grilled chicken and my husband loved the pork chops. Salads an vegetables were also quite good.  The atmosphere is cozy with brick walls, many booths, and tables with very comfortable lighting.  This may become our "go to" comfort spot for a very nice but reasonable dinner.

data.title: Awesome Banana Creme Pie
data.text: We had the mushrooms for appetizer. They were ok. The breading was soggy. My lady ordered the Hawaiian marinated Ribeye and said it was good. I had the grilled pork chop and it was good. We were full,so we ordered a piece of the Banana Creme Pie to go. Later when we ate the pie we were sorry we didn't get the whole pie. We both agreed that it is the best Banana Creme Pie we have ever eaten.

data.title: Delicious Downtown restaurant!!
data.text: Delicious food at a great price. We are a family of five and always looking for restaurants that feed our kids good food at affordable prices. Colby's restaurant does just that. Kids meals are 5.00 and include drink, meal and dessert. The portions are awesome! My husband had grilled chicken topped with ham and cheese and raved about how awesome it was. I had the blackened salmon and it was a good portion. Cannot wait to go back and get salmon again. The fettuccini was amazing. Best part is, you can get it as a side with your main meal. Now onto the best part....the dessert!! My husband got the warm pecan pie and was amazed. The desserts the kids got free with their meals was a brownie topped with vanilla icecream. Yummy!! Cannot wait to return to Colby's!!!

data.title: Delicious Early Evening Dinner
data.text: My husband and I stopped at Colby's for an early evening dinner as we were traveling through Owensboro. We had never been there and were pleasantly surprised and pleased with the ambience, wait staff - and most importantly - our meals. The grilled salmon was delicious and the prime rib was exactly what my husband wanted. We'll definitely go back!

data.title: Incredible!
data.text: Delicious every time. Salmon is the best I have had anywhere. Super consistancy. A separate bar for quiet conversation. Locally owned makes a difference here.

data.title: Delicious Food, Friendly Place
data.text: Extensive and delicious menu. Never fails to please everyone. Locals and out-of-towners alike. Casual atmosphere with local hospitality.

data.title: Great Food & Atmosphere
data.text: We dined here while visiting friends in the area.  This is one of their favorite restaurants and now we know why.  The food was great and it was a fun atmosphere.  We had the "Our House Chicken" and it was delicious.  As it was a busy Saturday evening, we had to wait about 20 minutes for a table, but it was well worth it!

data.title: Great fresh food
data.text: The restaurant was louder then what I would have liked, however my salmon bacon lettuce and tomato sandwich was delicious. Our waitress was polite professional and efficient.

data.title: Fine Food
data.text:
Arguably on of the better meals I have as a  business road warrior.  I sat in the bar for this meal.  The tap beer selection was good.  The food was fresh and deliciously prepared.  

The house made salad dressings were worth writing home about.

data.title: A night out
data.text: I had not been going to Colbys that often lately. The reason being location more than anything. Over the last three months I have dined twice and neither time was I disappointed in my service, quality of food or atmosphere. Recommend it to family or couples looking for a consistent quality of food and service. The first visit I had a steak and it was cooked as requested - medium rare. The next visit we sat at the bar and ate and what a pleasant experience. I had a fish dish and again superb. Our bartender/ server was Mr Colby! You will not be disappointed if you eat at Colbys.

data.title: Little piece of elegant
data.text: This is a beautiful little restaurant, the food is good and great service.  The food may be a little on the pricey side for some however we enjoy going to this restaurant.

data.title: Delicious!!
data.text: Service is always good. Love the prime rib sandwich.  Long Island tea is the best of any I've ever had.   Does take a few minutes to get seated but it's worth the wait.

data.title: Hidden gem
data.text: This is place known to, and loved by, locals.  The best place in town to get a steak. The atmosphere is a wonderful break from chain restaurants.  The pork chops are also outstanding.  You won't regret stopping by!

data.title: A must do while in Owensboro!
data.text: We were seated promptly at our reservation time. The food and service were both outstanding! A beautiful old building in the heart of downtown Owensboro.

data.title: Great place to eat!
data.text: Driving through and decided to stop and eat on a Saturday night. I had the prime rib, baked potato, and salad. Everything was great. We were there at 5:00 so we got the early dinner for $14.95. That price also included a drink and dessert. As an appetizer we got the fried mushrooms which we started gobbling them up before I realize I forgot to take a picture! We did notice that after 6 it got very crowded and many people had reservations. Highly recommended!

data.title: Noisy
data.text: I've only eaten here a couple times and there's a reason.  The food was ok, but it is so noisy inside,  you can hardly hear yourself talk. The ceiling has a 'metal' type covering on it so the people who are all talking  are amplified making it extremely loud.  Just not a place I'd frequent.

data.title: Good food, good vibe
data.text:
I have been here a few times now. The first time I went, the burger was great. The second time, it was dry and flavorless. So, on this particular visit I opted for chicken tenders. They are actually some of the best chicken tenders I've ever had. Their bbq sauce is great, kind of unique.

Their potato soup wasn't at all what I expected. It was good, but reminded me more of the filling to a chicken pot pie, without the chicken.  Not my style, but wasn't bad.

data.title: Not much for a vegetarian
data.text: At first glance this seemed like a good choice for a group to get a good lunch. We were hoping for a "something for everyone" type place. The only thing for a vegetarian is a salad. It seems a bit odd in this day and age when so many people choose to go vegetarian for so many reasons that there would not be a few more options.
